messages.content:
To take a backup of modified or customized alert definitions:

1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
2. Select the folder which contains alert definitions that you want to backup and click Export Selected Definitions. To take a backup of all available alerts, select Alert definitions and then click Export All Definitions.

Note: If customization is done using only threshold values, no backup of alert definitions is required as these values are retained after upgrade (Page 2, Section 5).

messages.content:
Based on the provided context, here are the steps to take a backup of alert definitions:

1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
2. Select the folder which contains alert definitions that you want to backup and click Export Selected Definitions.

Steps for exporting all available alerts:
- 1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
- 2. Select Alert definitions and then click Export All Definitions.

Note: The context does not provide further details or command specifics for the "Export Selected Definitions" action.

messages.content:
To take a backup of alert definitions which might have been modified or customized:

1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
2. Select the folder which contains alert definitions that you want to backup and click Export Selected Definitions. To take a backup of all available alerts, select Alert definitions and then click Export All Definitions.
3. In SRM 4.3.x and later versions, go to Alerting Frontend UI under Local Manager, click Alert Definitions.

No specific steps are provided for versions earlier than SRM 4.3 regarding the export of alerting-contexts.xml.

Note: If the customization to the alert definitions is done using only threshold values, then backup of alert definitions is not required as threshold values are retained after upgrade (Page 1).
